III. INVESTIGATION
Rule Code & Rule 400.4126 Sufficiency of staff.
Section The licensee shall have a sufficient number of administrative,
Description supervisory, social service, direct care, and other staff on duty to
perform the prescribed functions required by these administrative
rules and in the agency’s program statement and to provide for
the continual needs, protection, and supervision of residents.
Violation Potential Rule or Statute Violation
Type
Allegation Youth B choked Youth A until he said he could not breathe
implying inadequate staff supervision. Youth A had no visible
injuries.
Investigation Document reviewed:
An incident report by Supervisor dated 2/4/24 at 7:45pm indicated
Youth B unplugged the computer and Youth A kicked his leg.
While coming upstairs, the two head locked each other. Youth A
said he could not breathe. They were separated by Staff 1 and
Staff 2.
Interviews:
I contacted Complainant, also Youth A’s Foster Care Worker. She
expressed no additional licensing concerns.
I spoke with Chief Administrator (CA) on 2/8/24 and read her the
allegation.
Therapist indicated she met with Youth A and B’s Foster Care
Workers on 2/8/24 and developed a separation plan for both
youths.
I arrived on-site at the facility on 2/9/24 and interviewed Youth A.
He said he was not in school that day because he has been
refusing. Youth A, age 13, stands 5-feet, 4-inches tall, and has
been at the facility for one year. He said the youths were in the
big playroom about to go upstairs. Youth A admitted, “I might
have bumped into Youth B which started the whole thing. We
started pushing each other. Youth B pulled me and pinned me on
the floor. He put his hand on my neck. The staff broke it up.
Youth E helped me up.” Youth A said he does not want to be
friends with Youth B.
2

On 2/9/24 I interviewed Youth B who is age 13 and stands 4-feet,
10-inches tall. He is much smaller in stature than Youth A and
has also been at the facility for one year. Youth B said Youth A
pushed him in the playroom by the computer (outside of camera’s
view). “When I passed him, I pushed him. Youth A pushed back,
and we started fighting. I put him in a headlock, we fell, and I
choked him on the ground. A male and two female staff stopped
it.” Youth B said he usually get along well with Youth A and
believes they can make up and be friends.
I interviewed Staff 1 at the facility on 2/13/24. She said she was in
the small tv room which adjoins to the big playroom when she
heard Youth E say “fight.” Staff 1 entered the playroom and saw
Youth A and Youth B entangled on the floor. Youth A was saying
“Let go. I can’t breathe.” Staff 1 verbally directed both youths to
let go and they released each other. “I asked Youth A if he was
okay, and he said yes.” Youth A got up and walked up the stairs.
Staff 1 did not see any marks or bruises on Youth A’s neck.
I interviewed Staff 2 at the facility on 2/13/24. He has worked at
the facility for six months. Staff 2 recalled Youth A and Youth B
were both in negative moods the day of the fight. In the playroom,
the boys “clashed and grabbed” at each other. “I verbally
intervened. They fell to the ground I stepped in to break them up.
Youth A said he couldn’t breathe. I grabbed Youth B’s arm off of
his neck. I don’t know who stood up first. I walked Youth B
upstairs to cool off.” Staff 2 said he saw Youth B with a ¾”
superficial scratch on his chin and Youth A had no marks or
bruises.
I interviewed Youth E at the facility on 2/13/24. He has been at
the facility for ten months. Youth E said Youth B provokes Youth
A by talking negatively about his family and racial background.
“Youth A threw a punch at Youth B and Youth B tried to put him in
a chokehold. They went to the floor and Youth A said he couldn’t
breathe. Staff 1 and Staff 2 broke it up and pulled them apart. I
told them to stop and helped Youth A up.” Youth E did not see
marks or bruises on either boy.
Video of big playroom:
Eleven youths, one supervisor and three staff are exiting the big
playroom single file. Youth A and Youth B are the last youths to
exit with Staff 1 and Staff 2 a few feet behind. Youth A extends
his arm toward Youth B as he passes him, causing Youth B to
flinch. Youth B swings back at Youth A. Youth A grabs Youth B’s
left shoulder and pulls him back. Youth B turns around and swings
3

at Youth A with his right fist. The boys physically engage. Youth
B puts Youth A in a headlock. Youth A wraps his arm around
Youth B’s shoulder area, and they go to the floor. Youth B is on
top of Youth A and punches him in the face with his left fist. Youth
A grabs Youth B’s face with both hands attempting to scratch him.
Youth E reenters the room and bends over the boys. Staff 3
redirects Youth E away from the boys. Staff 2 and Staff 1 bend
over the boys and physically remove their grips from one another.
Youth B stands up and exits the room on his own without
assistance. Youth A remains lying on the floor alone for 40
seconds. Youth E extends his arm down to help him up. Youth A
stands up and exits the room. The boys fought on the floor for a
total of 12 seconds.
Analysis Staff 1 and Staff 2 were supervising and physically intervened to
stop the fight between Youth A and Youth B.
Conclusion Violation Not Established
IV. RECOMMENDATION
Based on investigative findings the facility is in compliance with all applicable
licensing statutes and rules. It is recommended that the current license status be
continued.
